channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: There are two kinds of information, pure and impure. https://t.co/vR7aJc8i9m
item.source:markdown: There are two kinds of information, pure and impure. https://t.co/vR7aJc8i9m

item.description: What happens when Presidents speak bluntly. https://t.co/A8Mk9WdNmi
item.source:markdown: What happens when Presidents speak bluntly. https://t.co/A8Mk9WdNmi

item.description: This brief thread from @DanielABarber reminds me of the challenge of helping students learn the beauty and urgency of their professional field while also learning enough realistic activism skills to have a hope of giving their best ideas a fair chance out there in the world. https://t.co/ygQVM9OxtA
item.source:markdown: This brief thread from @DanielABarber reminds me of the challenge of helping students learn the beauty and urgency of their professional field while also learning enough realistic activism skills to have a hope of giving their best ideas a fair chance out there in the world. https://t.co/ygQVM9OxtA

item.description: @herdyshepherd1 @howemill @grassfedsheep Conferences often hold the world off at a bit of a distance, under a gauze of academic jargon and government policy lingo, when people know real things are at stake back home.
item.source:markdown: @herdyshepherd1 @howemill @grassfedsheep Conferences often hold the world off at a bit of a distance, under a gauze of academic jargon and government policy lingo, when people know real things are at stake back home.

item.description:
They like our silence, when they can get it.

We should all publicize these revealing clues to how an elected official thinks about duty to citizens.

For example, one recent Member of Congress here in Indiana only visited parts of the district that voted her way. https://t.co/8VpAGFoaSt
item.source:markdown:
They like our silence, when they can get it.
We should all publicize these revealing clues to how an elected official thinks about duty to citizens.
For example, one recent Member of Congress here in Indiana only visited parts of the district that voted her way. https://t.co/8VpAGFoaSt

item.description: C-19 shot in the upper right arm today. There will be no innings pitched in relief tomorrow, I can already tell.
item.source:markdown: C-19 shot in the upper right arm today. There will be no innings pitched in relief tomorrow, I can already tell.

item.description: More characters will come on stage, more events will unfold, but the heart of the novel is present in the first several pages. https://t.co/2JHlddHpKf

item.description: The bees know how to come back, if there is something to come back to. https://t.co/Yc3VnaBKfB
item.source:markdown: The bees know how to come back, if there is something to come back to. https://t.co/Yc3VnaBKfB

item.description: "Taught to deal with body parts rather than human beings, [they] were treating the disease and ignoring the patient." https://t.co/fIWotUEhWU
item.source:markdown: "Taught to deal with body parts rather than human beings, [they] were treating the disease and ignoring the patient." https://t.co/fIWotUEhWU

item.description:
A quarter of a century ago, folks needed clues about how to read a blog. And they might not have expected that a blog was a show-your-work, thinking-in-process space, not just a place to post polished pieces.

https://t.co/SFdbJmtgpQ https://t.co/EGHPVMkqQ7
item.source:markdown:

item.description:
Hoosier GOP politicians support Trump-style chaos and corruption.

They adore gerrymandering, which is vote theft.

The best are gutless, the worst are corrupt. They don't deserve to be in office.

For the good of our communities, our state and nation, VOTE THEM OUT in November.
item.source:markdown:
Hoosier GOP politicians support Trump-style chaos and corruption.
They adore gerrymandering, which is vote theft.
The best are gutless, the worst are corrupt. They don't deserve to be in office.
For the good of our communities, our state and nation, VOTE THEM OUT in November.

item.description: How a country usually slides into civil war: A group cherishes its power but sees it slipping, organizes and arms, and provokes confrontations that can be used to justify deeper violence. https://t.co/lN7tYB6KQk
item.source:markdown: How a country usually slides into civil war: A group cherishes its power but sees it slipping, organizes and arms, and provokes confrontations that can be used to justify deeper violence. https://t.co/lN7tYB6KQk

item.description: "As Biden’s words made clear, nothing less than democracy itself is on the ballot." https://t.co/Z5YKD8oFsL
item.source:markdown: "As Biden’s words made clear, nothing less than democracy itself is on the ballot." https://t.co/Z5YKD8oFsL

item.description: "Biden did what he had to do. We have reached a watershed in American politics. The president of the United States has told us directly that our system of government is under attack. What happens next is, in every way, up to us." https://t.co/Rz7BuYtq9s
item.source:markdown: "Biden did what he had to do. We have reached a watershed in American politics. The president of the United States has told us directly that our system of government is under attack. What happens next is, in every way, up to us." https://t.co/Rz7BuYtq9s
